channel.title: KevinCTofel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from KevinCTofel.

item.description: @AlbrechtChris Took a while download Jedi Fallen Order but it looks quite good. Not as detailed as on my gaming rig with 1440p display and RTX 3080, of course. But mobile tech is always about compromise. So far, so good!
item.source:markdown: @AlbrechtChris Took a while download Jedi Fallen Order but it looks quite good. Not as detailed as on my gaming rig with 1440p display and RTX 3080, of course. But mobile tech is always about compromise. So far, so good!

item.description:
I wouldn‚Äôt want to use a Chromebook and E Ink monitor full time. However, this extended display with capacitive touch is great for reading and typing.

https://t.co/2WM2SPzEMG

Not bad for Twitter either! https://t.co/L3XZI5LmxT

item.description: @LinkofHyrule89 Nope. It wasn‚Äôt even manual option when Project Crostini launched: Once the disk size was set, that was it. Now at least you can do it manually. Eventually, it will be automatic.

item.description: @MBabiuk77 IMO: An Android tablet makes sense if you're primarily running Android apps. A Chromebook would be a better choice if you want a full desktop browser and only lean on Android from time to time.
item.source:markdown: @MBabiuk77 IMO: An Android tablet makes sense if you're primarily running Android apps. A Chromebook would be a better choice if you want a full desktop browser and only lean on Android from time to time.

item.description: The Acer Chromebook Vero 514 is built with recycled materials and has upgradable storage. That‚Äôs only half the story: See what $499 gets you. https://t.co/kDuwcSbMf5

item.description: I just sent the free, weekly About Chromebooks email newsletter to enjoy with that morning coffee. You have to supply the coffee, though. Want to join in for the Sunday newsletter? Read this week's edition and consider signing up here: https://t.co/yzi7MorLyw https://t.co/sO2ju00gS7
